definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother

sentences.english: The largest frog in the world is the giant salamander in China.
sentences.chinese: 最大的青蛙的世界，是在中国大鲵。

sentences.english: The axolotl, a neotenic species of salamander, a salamander that does not go through metamorphosis.
sentences.chinese: 娃娃鱼，大鲵，蝾螈的一种，产自墨西哥。

sentences.english: The evolutionary position of the spinal cord is also discussed.
sentences.chinese: 文中还就大鲵脊髓在进化历程中的位置作了讨论。

sentences.english: The ultrustracture of the liver of the Chinese giant salamander, Andrias davidianus (Blanchard) was studied with transmission electron microscopy (TEM).
sentences.chinese: 应用透射电镜对中国大鲵的肝脏进行了超微结构研究。

sentences.english: The general structural morphology of the liver of the Chinese giant salamander is also discussed in the paper.
sentences.chinese: 还讨论了中国大鲵肝脏的一般形态结构特点。

sentences.english: The male reproductive system of Andrias davidianus was studied and it consisted of testis, deferent duct, efferent duct and so on.
sentences.chinese: 运用电镜和光镜研究了大鲵雄性生殖系统结构。

sentences.english: Andrias davidianus is a special product and one of the rare animals of China.
sentences.chinese: 中国大鲵是中国的一种特有珍稀动物。

sentences.english: We look forward to 3 years through the efforts of the industry giant salamander bigger and stronger.
sentences.chinese: 我们期望通过3年的努力，把大鲵产业做大做强。

sentences.english: 17At up to six feet long, the Chinese giant salamander is the world's largest.
sentences.chinese: 最长达6英尺的中国大鲵，是世界上最大的鲵类。

definition: see 白鱀豚|白𬶨豚[bai2 ji4 tun2]
(bird species of China) golden pheasant (Chrysolophus pictus)
(bird species of China) scaly-sided merganser (Mergus squamatus)
